general_advisory: Light rainfall may occur on Saturday & Sunday with generally cloudy to overcast sky conditions.

advisory: Planting from November to February is the optimum time for planting in well-drained soil with good irrigation facilities.
To control Fruit and shoot borer, spray Neem-based pesticide 1500ppm @600ml/acre followed by alternate spray of Spinosad 45% SC @70ml/acre and Thiodicarb@300g/acre at 15 days interval in dry weather.

Apply borax @ 4 kg/acre as soil application during transplanting in Cole crops to prevent Brown rot. If Borax was not applied during transplanting of seedlings, then spray Borax @ 2.5 g/litre. Spraying of Boron micronutrient should be done after two weeks of transplanting and two weeks before curd formation.
